EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Partners / Gary Ham (1330370099.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Partners / Gary Ham (1330370099.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Gary, I am sorry you are not satisfied with the new site; I have passed along your feedback for our marketing team. The information you are looking for can be found on my From: <http://info.mbopartners.com/advisor-info-s-conde.html">personal page. Also, I have addressed your questions below…. Thank you,Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. <span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"> Gary Ham [mailto:gham@grandpaham.com] Sent: Monday, February 27, 2012 8:13 AM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners / Gary Ham Sara, Your web site is a lot fancier and not near as informative as it used to be. That said, I have a couple of opportunities that may make MBO Partners useful for me. I need to know some of the specifics. 1. How do I set up? I would send you a link to enroll, you would complete first day on the job type paperwork and send me back a signed I-9 form via email. I sent the link for you to review. 2. What business identity to I use in a contract agreement. (I need a sample.) MBO would be named in the contract with the client so I am not sure what you mean. Our agreement is on the person page above.3. What are the ACTUAL terms and conditions of working with you. Once you sign up MBO will invoice your client based on the information you enter in our system. When the payment comes in MBO takes 5 % off the top (pre-tax) and then you set up a payroll distribution to yourself. The fee does drop to 1.5% when we receive 125(k) in billings and it will reset to 5% each anniversary year. This is the only way MBO get’s paid, there are no fees to set up, go to a new client, close the account etc. Do you have a more informative document/brochure than the less than superior sales pitch on your web site? The only reason I am even asking is that I remember what you had before. It was clear, competent, and acceptable. Along with the link below please see <x-msg://398/:%20http:/info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Exec_vs_1099_Comparison.pdf">MBO vs. 1099 Respectfully, Gary Hamhttp://grandpaham.com703-899-6241 On Feb 16, 2012, at 6:34 PM, Sara Conde wrote:Hi Gary, Haha that makes sense. We actually do not have a rate card, our Associates directly negotiate their rates with the government hiring manager. Thanks,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services AdvisorMBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notifypostmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Gary Ham [mailto:gham@grandpaham.com]<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal> Sent: Wednesday, February 15, 2012 3:54 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners / Gary Ham Sara, You missed the tag line - just a bit of a pun involved. It is "Grandpa can do IT!" Please note the capitalization of the final word (geek that I am). :-) As for the Contract vehicle, I may just try it at some point, but I think most of the Gov guys would want the hourly rate and work category pre-established. Do you have examples (names and rate redacted) that would show someone who has done what you suggest below? Respectfully, Gary Ham <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://grandpaham.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D">http://grandpaham.com<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal>703-899-6241 On Feb 14, 2012, at 6:20 PM, Sara Conde wrote: Hi Gary, My name is Sara Conde and I am helping out Steve. I wanted to introduce myself and address your email below. First and foremost I want to thank you for referencing MBO on your site, we really appreciate that. I also wanted to let you know I love the way you have branded yourself and the tagline “Grandpa Can Do It” is great. We are on the GSA schedule so if you wanted to use MBO with government work you would simply bid on the work, get awarded the BPA, then reference MBO as your contract vichael via our GSA #. I have attached some more information on this. Please let me know if you have any additional questions. Take care!Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services AdvisorMBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D">sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Gary Ham [mailto:gham@grandpaham.com]<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal> Sent: Tuesday, February 14, 2012 9:49 AM To: Steve Arhancet Subject: Re: MBO Partners / Gary Ham Steven, I am doing just fine on my own at the moment (actually for the last 5 years). I once considered you as an option. In fact, I still have you as a link at <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://grandpaham.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D">grandpaham.com as an option for any prime contractors or Gov't type who would be queasy dealing with an independent. I might also be interested at some point in selling through you, if you had an IT contract vehicle of some sort the a Government manager could use with reasonable ease. That I would be willing to talk personally about. I am an IT consultant, Primarily software architecture and design, although I am a pretty good Java programmer as well. It is all on my web site (although I do need to update the resume a bit). I am also an accountant/comptroller by original training (which is why I do not fear such things as taxes or bookkeeping). It is kind of fun to keep my hand in. R/s Gary Hamhttp://grandpaham.com<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal>703-899-6241 On Feb 14, 2012, at 9:30 AM, Steve Arhancet wrote:
Dear Gary, I noticed that you recently visited our website! We had a conversation some time ago regarding our services. As a courtesy I wanted to personally reach out and offer any assistance I can to help you find the answers you might be looking for. If you would like to chat, you may easily book a time convenient for you in my online schedule by going here <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&https://my.timedriver.com/C9CPC?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D" target="_blank">https://my.timedriver.com/C9CPC<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal>. Regards, Steven___________________________________Steve ArhancetDirector, Consultant ServicesMBO Partners t: (703) 793-6011f: 703.793.6081e: <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sarhancet@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfFlYuGdx%2Bf2XJrnslzTNNJunttYXY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D">sarhancet@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal><image001.gif> <MBO_GSA_Price_List.pdf>
